Note: I included "Cardioprotective effects" as a disease because it refers to the medical condition of protecting the heart from damage or injury. "Isoproterenol-induced myocardial stress" is a disease condition in which isoproterenol, a synthetic catecholamine, is used to induce myocardial stress or damage in experimental models.
